result.execSummary:
The defendant Genevieve S. Thornberry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 14CF211 AND 15CF13 AND 15CM360 (Cash bond posted 7-23-2014)
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH Z.R. OR WITH VICTIM A.G.M. (dob 9-4-1999) or R.J.M. (dob 3-31-1980). NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH MINORS WITH THE EXCLUSION OF HER OWN CHILD.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Genevieve S. Thornberry in court with attorney James B. Duquette.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files new misdemeanor criminal complaint.  Defendant enters a NG plea to the charges in the Complaint.  Defendant's existing Bond shall now also cover this file.  The Defendant will be entering a guilty plea to these charges at the time of sentencing on file 2015CF000013.  The parties will be free to argue for an appropriate sentence on these misdemeanor charges.  Minutes filed.  Plea and sentencing scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
